DOCNAME: CASE OF GEORGIEVA AND MUKAREVA v. BULGARIA
JUDGES: Georgieva;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Pavlina Panova;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE . They are mother and daughter .

CARDINAL . In DATE the first applicant and her husband bought from the FAC municipality an apartment of QUANTITY , situated in the centre of the city , which had become State property by virtue of the nationalisations carried out by the communist regime in GPE after DATE .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date after that the first applicant 's husband died and his property was inherited by the CARDINAL applicants .
CARDINAL . In DATE LAW entered into force .

CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL of the heirs of the former pre - nationalisation owner of the flat brought proceedings against the applicants under section CARDINAL of LAW . In a final judgment of ORG the action was allowed partially , the domestic courts finding that the plaintiff could only claim CARDINAL of the property .

CARDINAL . The courts found that the applicants ' title CARDINAL of the property was null and void on CARDINAL grounds : CARDINAL ) their apartment had been part of a bigger apartment , which had , prior to DATE and in breach of the relevant construction requirements , been divided by the ORG into CARDINAL ; and CARDINAL ) the area where the apartment was located had been earmarked for the construction of buildings of CARDINAL storeys and the applicants ' building was of CARDINAL storeys ; the relevant legislation at the time prohibited the sale of apartments in such buildings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested to be compensated with compensation bonds for CARDINAL of the property . The request was granted and in DATE the applicants received bonds for MONEY ( ORG ) , the equivalent of MONEY ( ORG ) , in accordance with an expert valuation of a CARDINAL of their apartment drew up in DATE or DATE . On DATE the applicants sold their bonds for PERCENT of their face value and received ORG CARDINAL , the equivalent of ORG CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE , following a legislative amendment whereby the time - limit to bring an action under section CARDINAL of LAW was renewed , the remaining heirs of the former pre - nationalisation owner brought such an action against the applicants regarding DATE of the apartment .

CARDINAL . The action was granted in a final judgment of ORG of DATE . Putting forward arguments identical to the ones concerning DATE of the apartment ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , the courts found that the applicants ' title to DATE of the property was likewise null and void .
CARDINAL . The applicants did not apply for compensation bonds for that CARDINAL of the apartment , as they were entitled to .

CARDINAL . On several occasions after DATE the first applicant requested to be provided with municipal housing but was informed that no such housing was available . By DATE the CARDINAL applicants and the second applicant 's family were still living in the disputed flat . In DATE they vacated it and rented another apartment . In DATE the second applicant bought another flat and her family and the first applicant moved in there .

CARDINAL . The relevant background facts and domestic law and practice have been summarised in the ORG 's judgments in the cases of ORG and Others v. GPE ( nos . CARDINAL , ORG , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , GPE , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , ORG , and CARDINAL , DATE ) and ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
